text:
="preserve">Leonard Edward "Lennie" Mayne (8 November 1927 – 20 May 1977) was an Australian television director. He was best known for directed four "Doctor Who" serials, "The Curse of Peladon" (1972), "The Three Doctors" (1972), "The Monster of Peladon" (1974) and "The Hand of Fear" (1976). He also worked on television series such as "Warship" and "The Onedin Line". He was married to actress Frances Pidgeon.
Mayne died after drowning in a sailing accident on the English Channel in May 1977.
